answerText: Mr. Flood's Party [10] "Mr. Flood's Party" was written by this poet, who wrote of a "child of scorn" that was "born too late" and thus "kept on drinking" in "Miniver Cheevy."
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Seven Lakes/Rockefeller  | 20 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The title character of this poem is compared to "Roland's ghost winding a silent horn" as he looks down on a town "where strangers would have shut the many doors that many friends had opened long ago."  For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem about a figure who stops in the road and has a drink with himself.
